lines.text:
[after calhounhas left the office]
Nothin's done right unless Tough Willy does it himself.

[Calhoun has evidently heard the comment and angrily reenters, hands on hips and glaring]
How long you been working here?
You need twenty-five years before you're eligible for a pension...
[He takes a piece of fruit from the lunchbox on the desk]
... and you won't make it. Not if you ever call me Willy.
[He throws the fruit at the policeman and leaves]
The people you have to deal with are lice. They never keep their word to anyone about anything; they won't to you.
Gonna send that kid home, aren't you, Joe? I mean after we collect.
She'll go home... they ever fish her out of the river. Let's have the coffee, huh?
You will let my father go, won't you?

[Flippantly]
Why should I hurt the old boy or you, Cookie? I don't bit the hand that feeds me a hundred grand.

[to Marley]
I may have to beat your brains out. You'll have to decide that.

[Sadistically to Lorna about the high tension cables that are all around her]
All you gotta do, Cookie, is get up and take a walk. You'll fry so fast it'll curl your hair.
I'll break any man who takes his eyes off that suitcase.

[to Joyce]
If anyone asks me to stick my neck out, I want to know who's doing the askin'.
